properties.description: A chronic suppurative and cicatricial disease of the apocrine glands occurring chiefly in the axillae in women and in the groin and anal regions in men. It is characterized by poral occlusion with secondary bacterial infection, evolving into abscesses which eventually rupture. As the disease becomes chronic, ulcers appear, sinus tracts enlarge, fistulas develop, and fibrosis and scarring become evident.

Top 5 easy DIY ways to remove & clear HS in 7 days

- Reduce fatty foods in your diet
- Wear clean & better fitting underwears 
- Scrub that area twice a week 
- Diluted dettol & cotton swab everyday at night 
- moisturize that area with quick absorbing oils eg: almond or bio oil

What is hidradenitis suppurativa? 

It’s an inflammatory skin condition that causes painful, pea-sized (sometimes larger), nodular bumps under the skin. 

It mainly affects specific areas of the body. The most common areas being the groin, under arms, and under breasts.

Hey y’all 👀 the weather is warming up a bit now, and we know many of you (and some members of our team too!) experience more HS flare ups during the warmer months due to the friction + heat. 

So today, we’ll be discussing hidradenitis suppurativa, otherwise known as HS. 🤠

- Hidradenitis Suppurativa (HS)
- Hyperhidrosis (primary and secondary)
- Body odor (Bromhidrosis)
